title: The Last Girl at the End of Time
premise: A young woman, the sole survivor of a ritual that sacrificed her entire town to an ancient cosmic entity, discovers she wasn't saved by chance. She is the entity's chosen vessel, and its incomprehensible consciousness is slowly overwriting her own from the inside out. To survive, she must journey into the decaying, non-Euclidean ruins left in the entity's wake to find a way to sever the connection, knowing that if she fails, she will become the door through which it consumes all of reality.
protagonist: Elara Vance, a pragmatic astronomy student who survived the 'Grey Thanksgiving' when her town vanished into a silent, shimmering void.
conflict: Elara's internal battle against the alien consciousness colonizing her mind, while external forces—a cult that worships the entity, and a government agency that sees her as a threat to be eliminated—hunt her, believing she is the key to either summoning or stopping the apocalypse.
setting: Present-day American Southwest, bleeding into distorted, transient pocket dimensions and psychic landscapes shaped by the entity's influence.
tone: A relentless, existential dread punctuated by moments of profound body horror and cosmic awe; a race against time where the enemy is both within and beyond the stars.
